Leadership is fairly incompetent and rely on just getting “yes people” to do whatever they are told so they aren’t looking for talent that will innovate processes.

-Hiring friends are director levels and ignoring their incompetence

You really need to know more? It’s a good time to get out and bad time to get in. Wait until senior leadership changes for their to be change.

review_title: Licensing Agent: Decent gig with a few caveats
pros:
Salary & benefits
Office location (Downtown Montreal)
Office parties & events (Their events coordinator is brilliant!)
Office closes between Christmas & New Years
Going to concerts is part of the job
The travel budget is reasonable
Employees tend to stay.
cons:
It's easy to fool yourself into thinking this is a sales job. It's really a collections job. 
The computer tools you have to work with are downright awful. 
Dealing with people who think they can circumvent copyright law can be frustrating. 
You will spend a lot of time working on very low-value accounts. 
Extremely limited upward mobility; lots of lateral movement. 
BD positions abolished and replaced with lower-paying versions
Very political environment. 

At the end of the day, it's not a bad gig, especially if you come from a collections background. I personally hated the job but liked the organization.
